fields.description:
h3. Summary
User report generated from Cucumber-js is not supported because it's missing "id and type" in the parameter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a pipeline test report from Cucumber-js
# Pipeline found the report
# No report is shown after build finished

h3. Expected Results
Expected pipeline report not to be strict with a missing parameter

h3. Actual Results
Failed to parse the XML report in pipeline build
fields.summary: Pipeline report XML generate from Cucumber-js is not supported

fields.description:
When notified (via email) of permissions granted have the ability to contact the person who granted them or to reject those permissions.

I recently was incorrectly assigned read write access to all repositories for a defense force contractor who I have no relationship with. I found it very difficult to work out how to reject my permissions or to contact the admin to let them know of their mistake. Their profile was private and I ended up sending the guy a message via linked it as I couldn’t find any other way of contacting them.

Also finding the button to leave the team was difficult. Maybe your notification could just have a shortcut to this. As it was I had to access the repository that I shouldn’t have been in to find the link.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Contact admins when permissions are granted.

fields.description:
When I first signed into Bitbucket cloud, it took a good while for me to learn that there was even a dashboard. The signup process ended on my profile page at https://bitbucket.org/<username> - where I saw the below screen:

!2502764464-bitbucket%20repositories%20screen.png|thumbnail!\\
I had been invited to work on a specific project, so I expected to see the repositories I’d been granted access to here.

Only recently, I’ve learned that there’s a page for viewing the repositories I can contribute to at https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories . Why isn’t that mentioned on the profile page? Why don’t any of my branches show up on the profile’s repositories page? To be honest the profile pages look very authoritative, so I didn’t even consider the possibility that there were some _other_ dashboard or some other Repositories page on the site.

‌

Please add a link to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories alongside {{Create your first repo}} and {{Import a repository from GitHub}} .

‌

Alternatively, here are some other suggestions that I think could help with this issue. In no particular order:

# add text explaining how this page differs from the dashboard’s repositories (I still don’t know what the difference is)
# add a link to a confluence page in the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-bitbucket/work-on-a-repository-861185298.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-bitbucket/work-on-a-repository-861185298.html] section explaining how to find the repositories I’ve been given access to. There currently isn’t any such page so that would have to be created too
# mention using the search feature to find a repository, or that search can take you directly to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories
# change the text at the top of the viewport and in the left sidebar from {{Repositories}} to something more specific

## assuming that I understand the difference between the two pages correctly, perhaps {{Repositories I've Created}} would make it clear that these are not necessarily repositories I contribute to, but rather repositories which I personally own
# display the word {{Dashboard}} next to the button that takes you to the dashboard
# display the word {{Dashboard}} in the tooltip for the button that takes you to the dashboard
# add a new button labeled e.g. {{Leave Profile}}, informing me that I am not currently looking at the dashboar
fields.summary: The 'Repositories' section of my profile should have a link to the 'Repositories' section of the dashboard

I noticed that yesterday and today the git ls-remote (like this: ‘git ls-remote --symref [git@bitbucket.org|mailto:git%40bitbucket.org]:qamine/repository-listener.git HEAD "refs/heads/_" "refs/pull/_"’) operation is running really slow, taking several minutes to complete for small projects. However, everything is ok in your status page. Are you aware of this?

Thanks.

fields.description:
Why hide the total number in a tooltip when it can be show easily. This is a bad UX.

!4056838869-image.png|thumbnail!\\
There is no good reason to use a tooltip instead, there is plenty of room on the screen. Note that the 99+ is 3 digits, just like the 117 is also 3 digits, so there no space is saved. Pointless and user unfriendly.

(this is seen in the pull request list in the personal dashboard)
fields.summary: Show total comments not just 99+ when there are more than 99 comments

**Any additional minutes you buy are available until the end of your current billing cycle.”

fields.description:
i have pipeline in jenkins and use git plugin to clone repository,  As of lately i found a lot same error.

*1: 403 Forbidden Permission*\\
We use "jenkins-autodeployment" account for accessing git repos. This account is a member admin group on BitBucket. admin is granted permission to access all git repos of corporation . So by right, "jenkins-autodeployment" account should have access to all bitbucket but somehow we get 403 forbidden access for this account sometimes. We notice that this problem occurs more often lately. By adding "jenkins-autodeployment" account manually to git repo, we solve this 403 forbidden access problem.

*2: fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly*\\
For all the cases reported, beside the 403 problem, they are all caused by the remote server end hung up unexpectedly. In this case it is BitBucket terminates connection for some unknown reason. We notice that by disable git shallow fetch ( --depth=1 ), the problem does not occur anymore.

Please kindly support and investigate this case because now blocking developer to work

Configure Jenkins

{code:groovy}
checkout([
    $class: 'GitSCM', 
    branches: [[name: "*/master"]], 
    doGenerateSubmoduleConfigurations: false, 
    extensions: [[
      $class: 'CloneOption', 
      depth: 1, 
      noTags: true, 
      reference: '', 
      shallow: false
    ]], 
    submoduleCfg: [], 
    userRemoteConfigs: [[
      credentialsId: bitbucket-credential, 
      url: git_openshift_configuration
    ]]
{code}

‌

Jenkins log

{code}
using credential bitbucket-credential
Cloning the remote Git repository
Avoid fetching tags
Cloning repository https://bitbucket.org/xxxxxx/app-configs.git
 > git init /home/jenkins/workspace/update-config # timeout=10
Fetching upstream changes from https://bitbucket.org/xxxxxx/app-configs.git
 > git --version # timeout=10
using GIT_ASKPASS to set credentials 
 > git fetch --no-tags --progress https://bitbucket.org/xxxxxx/app-configs.git +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/* # timeout=10
ERROR: Error cloning remote repo 'origin'
hudson.plugins.git.GitException: Command "git fetch --no-tags --progress https://bitbucket.org/xxxxxx/app-configs.git +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*" returned status code 128:
stdout: 
stderr: error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 403
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}
fields.summary: Problem  "stderr: error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 403 fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly"

fields.description:
The Markup/Markdown text of an issue-description placed in Bitbucket's built-in issue tracker (including this very one, that’s used for Bitbucket’s site itself) will load back for editing in a corrupted form if text contains characters such as greater-thans, less-thans, ampersands, single quotes, or double quotes. Submitting without making any changes in the text-box (for instance, just changing the issue-title) actually causes changes in the description because the reverse conversions do not occur, and the entity-codes are taken as literals. This causes further corruption on later edits because the new ‘&’s are then converted into {{&}}which is then (on next edit) converted to {{&amp;}}, etc.

Browsers used:

* Firefox 60.6.1esr
* Chrome 73.0.3683.103
* Firefox 67.0 (Quantum)
* Chrome 64.0.3282.167

Operating systems used:

* Windows 7 Enterprise
* Windows 10 Enterprise

To reproduce:

# Using one of the above browsers, create a new issue using Bitbucket’s internal issue-tracker.
# Into the description, paste the contents of the attached markdown file.
# Save the issue.
# Return to the issue you just created and select “Edit”.
# Note that occurrences of the above-listed characters will appear _in the editor itself_ as their HTML-entity representations e.g. {{'}}.
# (optional) Saving the document will result in these entities being saved literally, even if the user took no actions to change the description, but instead changed the issue-status, title, or other.
fields.summary: New Markdown editor replaces certain characters with HTML-safe entities

fields.description:
Hi,

While using README.rst files, it seems that the formatting is a little bit broken as there is no margin on top of any sections.

!1320109858-bitbucket_bug1.PNG|thumbnail!

This is mainly due to bundle.css line 156 where the first-child of any H* class is set forced margin-top:0.  If I remove this rule, this seems to make the formatting a lot better:

!2663557638-bitbucket_bug2.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Proper formatting of README.rst

fields.description: When we create a file from the Bitbucket cloud UI and edit the files using the online editor. It is not able to read diacritics such as accute “*ó*” and renders it as *o<?>*. This doesn’t happen during editing. But, is seen when we commit and view the file which is not an expected behaviour. Attached are a coupe of screen captures showing the same.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Online File editor unable to detect diacritics.

[https://bitbucket.org/bloodrizer/kitten-game/issues/162/bug-fr-craft-all-shouldn-t-overfill|https://bitbucket.org/bloodrizer/kitten-game/issues/162/bug-fr-craft-all-shouldn-t-overfill]

fields.description:

Could we get a minimise button that collapses files?

From the Create Branch page, I search for 'master'. There are a large number of branches with names like {{<prefix>-master}} and only the first 10 matching branches are displayed in the dropdown, but not my {{master}} branch. A message displays at the end of the dropdown prompting me to _'Type to Filter…'._ however, I’ve already typed out the full branch name.

Suggest listing exact matches first.
fields.summary: Cannot search for branch when creating a new branch

Please fix this issue.

Thanks,\\
Zeng

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As of 29th April 2019, the new source browser UI that replaced the older repository Overview and Source pages is now turned on for all users without an option to opt-out.

h3. Among some of the issues noticeable in the new UI:
* It only shows the file in a small area of the web page, which does not expand its height. It only displays 22 lines at a time on most computer screens.
* The sidebar on the right takes up too much space, and can't be removed. It's hard to collapse it as well.
* The scrolling doesn't work smoothly when also scrolling the web page.
* On the mobile browser, tapping it always makes the keyboard popup, even though the text is not editable.
* The syntax highlighting in the code doesn't use clear colors.

None of these problems happened on the previous code viewer, it would be great if we can still revert back to the old UI.
fields.summary: Allow us to revert back to the Old source browser UI.

fields.description:
Currently, '*Require issue keys in commit messages*' toggle under the *Links* tab within Repository Settings is a global setting for all branches exist under the repository.

It would be great if this functionality can be customized further for individual branches as well.
fields.summary: 'Require issue keys in commit messages' toggle to be customised for individual Branches

Until Thursday, APR 25, He cannot search any reviewers on input box. I'm not sure, What is a change or maybe some setting on my site had been change? I try to looking for a while, but nothing found. So could you please help me to take a look on it?\\

Thank you in advance.
fields.summary: The username atapon_los cannot search any reviewers

fields.description:
Sync and merge commits increase ahead/behind counter on target/source branch.

For example:\\
Create a production branch from master\\
Commit change A to master -> production is 1 behind master\\
Sync production -> production is 1 ahead master\\
Commit change B to master -> production is 1 behind / 1 ahead master\\
Sync production -> production is 2 ahead master

This is misleading as even though both branches are equal, the ahead/behind counters are not reflecting the real value.
fields.summary: Sync and merge commits increase ahead/behind counter

fields.description:
Given we have multiple users (more than 3) who approve the PR, after approving the PR, the avatar of the users which gets listed on the Bitbucket Pull Request List View comes scrambled.\\
This behaviour has come to see after the new PR list view was introduced on Bitbucket cloud (reference images 1&2).

Earlier, expected behaviour was to have latest users who updated the PR, their avatar to populate first in the PR list view.\\
This is still seen in the old PR list view and is not functioning as expected with the new PR list view.

Request to have this view aligned with the latest approver and not to scramble the avatars. This is required & consumed by users to identify whether if they approved it a while ago or not. Which avoids redundancy.
fields.summary: New Pull Request List View scrambles the avatar of the approver on the Bitbucket UI
Accept UUID in the body request of branch retrictions API

fields.description:
Some customers only want to run Pipelines if a certain commit message was provided.

Currently, it's the opposite feature of *[skip ci]*.

*Feature request*: It would be really helpful if we can have a feature like *[run ci]* that we can include in commit's message and build will only run with those commit's message.
fields.summary: Feature opposite of Skip CI

fields.description: Having the button would help us to scroll to the top easily and navigate through long page
fields.summary: Add "Scroll to top" button

fields.description:
When running our pipeline which is using deployment variables for our unit tests - the deployment variables are returning empty Strings instead of the content value that exists.

This is a new error and the pipeline has been using our variables just fine for the past 7mo - we also have not changed the variables or the code that processes them.

The pipeline reporting is also interpolating our variables into the error messages making it hard to read the console output. See attached.
fields.summary: Pipeline failing due to showing empty deployment variable that exists

fields.description:
In the past when I create an issue and assign it to a developer I could simply press on the drop down menu, see the list of developers/my team members and click on one to assign the task.

Over the past week some time you guys have rolled out an update that no longer allows me to do this!  It now looks like this "Find a user by their name" (seems you may have also added an 'assign to me' option to quickly assign a task to myself which is fine, but the problem is the missing auto list).  I am not sure if it's a bug that the list does not default display all members or you guys intentionally made it so I need to start typing a username before the team member will even be suggested (which makes no sense to me at all .. I have to memorise all of my team members usernames?).

!2592945107-issue1.png|thumbnail!

After using your service for many years and creating thousands of tasks I find this update to be extremely frustrating - before it used to take me 1-2 seconds just to click that Assign to menu and then directly click again to select who I wanted to assign the task to.  Now I need to click on the field and MANUALLY start typing a name because I can see any of my developers!  The list is actually empty until I start typing the developer's name!  So not only does it take me much longer now because I have to manually start typing just to see the list, I also need to memorise all of my developers usernames otherwise I cannot find them to assign the task to!!  Please fix this so we can actually see the list of team members again as default!  If you want to have the type and find team members, that's fine, but you need to provide a list of team members as deafult before a user starts typing as well!

!2152949633-issue2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Assignee Field Update is Frustrating!  Issue Tracker

fields.description:
Under Project Settings -> Chat Notifications, Settings -> Add Subscription

I used to be able to add myself here, using @myusername which would send slack notification to me from the Bitbucket Cloud bot. But now when I try to add myself to new projects, there are no search results and I can't add myself. I can only seem to add channels now.\\
Old projects still send notifications to me like they should and I can see @myusername in the settings. I just can't add myself anymore.
fields.summary: Slack notification: can't add single user as target anymore

fields.description:
Currently, when you click an issue key linked to Jira, a pop-up will show.

However, at some point, the popup seems not loading fast enough.\\
Hence, customers will need to wait until the popup is fully shown.

It would be best if we could have an option to enable or disable the Jira issue key popup.\\
The idea is that if the option is disabled, the link opens in a new tab.

h3. Workaround
Right-click the Jira issue link then click "Open link new tab".
fields.summary: Jira Issue Key Optional Popup

fields.description:
I am no longer able to create a branch from branches other than default (or tags). The search box returns tags but not branches. This previously worked as expected.

In the screen shot attached, you will see my search value = version- and only tags are showing up and not branches. If I continue to search, for my exact value = version-2019.5.x, there are no results.

This is a mercurial repository.

Also, the search ignores my keyboard input while "Loading". This is very annoying behavior.
fields.summary: Branch search fails to include correct branch results

fields.description: A repository with LFS had become unstable, it was groomed and upload to a different repository name.  In deprecating the unstable version, the delete repository function timed out and there nothing accessible to complete this task.  The index was 2.3 GB with 360 GB in LFS.  I need assistance with removing this from our account.
fields.summary: Deleting a large repository with LFS times out, leaving it in a unaddressable state

fields.description:
Today on Bitbucket it's possible to create account environment variables and repository environment variables, which help with scope control for Pipelines.\\
However, this is currently not possible for projects.

This feature request requests the ability to add environment variables at a project level.
fields.summary: Allow creation of Pipelines variables on project level

fields.description:
Hello, it seems there is an error on bitbucket pipeline. The service docker is not being installed anymore on my 'step'.

https://bitbucket.org/qualirede/coparticipacao-web/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/505
fields.summary: docker service is not working anymore on bitbuckets pipeline

fields.description: Currently, there is no way we can link a bitbucket issue with a commit or with a pull request.
fields.summary: Linking Bitbucket issue with commit/pull request

fields.description:
If I recall correctly, this feature was there before, but then disappeared not long ago. A bug?

We don't have many users on my team, so I've been enjoying the ability to just select an assignee without searching for one. Now i am required to type in their names.
fields.summary: Assignee dropdown no longer shows users before search

fields.description:
When I have been formatting my reply message - page stopped responding (awaited 10min not helped) (occurred several times)

Chromium\\
Version 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) Built on Ubuntu , running on Ubuntu 18.04 (64-bit)
fields.summary: Freezing on Replying on comment during `pull request` reviewing diff

fields.description:
Occasionally, in Bitbucket Pipelines, the displayed logs aren't showing under the correct command. The logs are correctly uploaded. However, they aren't mapped to the correct command. Also, the log doesn't download completely when downloaded from the UI.

Alternatively, the full logs can be obtained via API. The "Range" can be adjusted accordingly if the logs are large.

Link : [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/%7Bpipeline_uuid%7D/steps/%7Bstep_uuid%7D/log]
fields.summary: Log's on Bitbucket Pipelines shows under a different command

fields.description:
I delete all of the repositories of the following teams.\\
https://bitbucket.org/devsmartmlm/\\
https://bitbucket.org/icaicloud-sre/

But the teams are still there.

I asked all of the team members to access the team and leave the team, they also get the same page.

That link has no power here
fields.summary: I deleted two teams, but they are still there. "That link has no power here"

fields.description:
As a user I don't want to see the 'Run pipeline for branch' in /branches view when the pipeline feature is disabled.

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to your repository without pipelines enabled
# Navigate to branches
# In branch list view, got to three dot menu at the right side and click it
# Select 'Run pipeline for branch'

bq. Result:\\
It will show a message telling that pipeline is not enable for current repository\\
Expected result:\\
No option for running pipelines at all
fields.summary: Disable 'Run pipeline for branch' option when pipeline is not enabled for repository

fields.description:
The Bitbucket Pipelines on our {{java-agent}} repository use the Docker service to pull Docker images then start new Docker containers. Bitbucket has a significant number of errors when pulling Docker images using the Docker API. These errors can be seen in our [Pipeline 8141|https://bitbucket.org/contrastsecurity/java-agent/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/8141]; here is an example

{code}

Apr 23, 2019 4:15:12 PM com.github.dockerjava.core.async.ResultCallbackTemplate onError
SEVERE: Error during callback
com.github.dockerjava.api.exception.InternalServerErrorException: {"message":"Get https://contrastsecurity-docker.jfrog.io/v2/contrast/websphere-csrf/manifests/rev2: Get https://contrastsecurity-docker.jfrog.io/contrastsecurity/api/docker/docker/v2/token?account=EnterpriseDeployUser&scope=repository%3Acontrast%2Fwebsphere-csrf%3Apull&service=contrastsecurity-docker.jfrog.io: net/http: request canceled (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)"}
	at com.github.dockerjava.jaxrs.filter.ResponseStatusExceptionFilter.filter(ResponseStatusExceptionFilter.java:53)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.ClientFilteringStages$ResponseFilterStage.apply(ClientFilteringStages.java:140)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.ClientFilteringStages$ResponseFilterStage.apply(ClientFilteringStages.java:128)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.process.internal.Stages.process(Stages.java:171)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.ClientRuntime.invoke(ClientRuntime.java:257)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.JerseyInvocation$2.call(JerseyInvocation.java:701)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.internal.Errors.process(Errors.java:315)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.internal.Errors.process(Errors.java:297)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.internal.Errors.process(Errors.java:228)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.process.internal.RequestScope.runInScope(RequestScope.java:444)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.JerseyInvocation.invoke(JerseyInvocation.java:697)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.JerseyInvocation$Builder.method(JerseyInvocation.java:448)
	at org.glassfish.jersey.client.JerseyInvocation$Builder.post(JerseyInvocation.java:349)
	at com.github.dockerjava.jaxrs.async.POSTCallbackNotifier.response(POSTCallbackNotifier.java:29)
	at com.github.dockerjava.jaxrs.async.AbstractCallbackNotifier.call(AbstractCallbackNotifier.java:50)
	at com.github.dockerjava.jaxrs.async.AbstractCallbackNotifier.call(AbstractCallbackNotifier.java:24)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

{code}

These errors are not new. Our solution for the past 8 months or so has been to wrap our Docker image pull API calls with logic to retry failed image pulls. This makes our build pipeline more stable, but of course can cause some pipelines to run for a long time when there are a large number of errors. [Pipeline 8141|https://bitbucket.org/contrastsecurity/java-agent/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/8141] is an example of a Pipeline with a significant number of errors (which can be seen in the console output). The errors caused the test to run for 100 minutes (usually completes in 60 minutes). We consider this a partial outage of Bitbucket Pipelines. Because we are using 2x instances, this is a costly failed run for us (200 build minutes). It is also costly to our dev team to wait 100 minutes to find out a build failed due to significant errors from the Bitbucket Pipelines Docker service
fields.summary: Abnormally high error rates on Bitbucket Pipelines Docker service

fields.description:
There is an intermittently recurring rendering bug of the Ahead/Behind column of Branches view (/branches/). See screenshots.

Opening new bug as I was unable to re-open someone elses bug about the same issue here:\\
BCLOUD-17417

The bug is not solved, it keeps recurring pretty much daily for me.\\
A full reload of the web page is does not resolve the issue when the bug is active. Usually the view returns to working fine an hour later or so. But the problem keeps coming back.
fields.summary: Ahead/Behind of branches not showing

fields.description:
This is a feature that has been brought up a few times, and I'm going to bring it up as well as you keep dismissing it.

Currently 'on hold' is basically synonymous with 'forget', as it doesn't show up anywhere except in queries which are too slow to be enjoyable.

I think the solution here is to add them to the 'open' list, but always at the bottom.

* BCLOUD-9125
* BCLOUD-1800
* BCLOUD-5683
* BCLOUD-2910
fields.summary: Feature Request - don't "hide" on-hold issues

fields.description: It would be best if we can have a feature to have a generic link for a pull request or maybe URL shortened for sharing across a certain team.
fields.summary: Pull request generic link for sharing

fields.description: I often change teams within my company and, at the suggestion of reviewers, I need to 'catch' the new reviewers. My suggestion is a simple option called 'clean up recent reviewers' which simply clear this list.
fields.summary: Option to 'clean up recent reviewers'

fields.description:
This has probably been asked before.

Over time I created a lot of snippets containing multiple files, most of them Markdown e.g. to document multiple steps of a process. Such snippets get really slow to work with because I'm not able to edit single files inside a snippet. Instead I have to edit the whole snippet which results in huge loading times.

Also, even if I follow a specific naming convention (00.file.md, 01.file.md, 02.file.py, ...) the order of the files still get messed up while editing the snippet.

I really want to use Bitbucket snippets for documentation (that does not belong to a specific repository). But right now it still sucks compared to any Note app with Markdown support. Being able to edit single files would be an improvement.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Snippets edit single files

fields.description:
Exclude files feature do not work if a pull request has too many file changes. The PR diff will timeout.

h3. Expected Result
Exclude files feature should work in a pull request even if the PR has too many file changes.

h3. Actual Result
Exclude files feature is not working

h3. Workaround
# Review the diff locally then merge the pull request in the UI or over API.
# Decline the pull request, chunk it into smaller ones then view the merge.
fields.summary: Exclude files feature do not work with a large diff pull request

fields.description:
Good day!

I'm creating a wordpress environment as part of our CI/CD.

I have a bitbucket repository for the environment which builds a docker image.

I have my custom plugins on their respective repositories on the same account with zip files from pipeline artifacts on the downloads page which is clean. (no extra files which is not needed for the plugin to function)

I need to add those zip files as custom plugins on the docker image. Submodules is not an option since extra files is also deployed which is not good. (Dockerfile, bitbucket-pipelines.yml etc)

Can you provide a sample bitbucket-pipelines.yml on how to do it? Any help is much appreciated!
fields.summary: How to download bitbucket private repository download page files of the same organization on pipelines?

fields.description:
I love the aws-s3-deploy pipe for pipelines, however it has only allowed me to remove half of my manual, aws-cli deploy code.

In most cases when I'm deploying to s3 from a pipeline, it's for a website so I also have a CloudFront instance that sits in front of it.

So normally for me, an s3 deploy is followed by a CloudFront invalidation.

So an aws-cloudfront-invalidate pipe would clean up my pipelines a heap and allow me to remove both of the aws-cli code files from my repos, instead of just the s3 deploy one :)
fields.summary: AWS Cloudfront Invalidate Pipe

fields.description:
It would be good to be able to manage groups from individual accounts as an admin of the individual account.

Currently it is only possible to manage repositories with admin access.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to manage groups for individual accounts

fields.description:
I have been thinking this feature must exist but I just wasn't cluey enough to find it, but alas, after reading here ( https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-Issue-Only-Users-No-Repo-Access/qaq-p/805359 ) I think there is little chance it exists.

There are numerous reasons someone would want to give access to the Issues of a repo (or the Issues and the Wiki) but not want to give access (yes even Read access!) to the repo itself!  Please add the ability to set privileges to allow for admis to give access to only the Issue Tracker (or only certain parts of a private repository) without having to give read access to the whole repository!
fields.summary: Allow user access only to the Issue Tracker inside a Private Repository
REST API /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/src/{node}/{path} returns an incorrect commit hash vs v1

fields.description:
Please implement Mermaid markdown live preview in file edit mode.\\
It would be really helpful to edit&review our requirements.\\
Thanks & Regards
fields.summary: Please implement Mermaid markdown live preview

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to your profile settings
# Set the language to Japanese(日本語)
# Click 変更する next to your workspace ID

h1. Expected behavior
User is navigated to the screen to update their workspace ID

h1. Actual behavior
An error happens saying "Something went wrong"
fields.summary: Unable to edit workspace ID if non-English is set as user language

fields.description:
I create a first pipeline in my project (Pipelines/settings)\\
After created, it was not displayed in any branches of the pipelines list\\
"/addon/pipelines/home"

Then, on the settings page, I found the "bitbucket-pipelines.yml" to edit and delete. I deleted it to start as the first time with the help\\
But now, on the "admin/pipelines/settings" page, it show a button to "configure bitbucket-pipelines.yml" and when I click on it, it display the "/pipelines/home/#!/getting-started" page with the short following content :

Hooray! You've successfully set up Pipelines.\\
When your pipeline starts up you'll see the details here.

But no link, no button, nothing to create a new pipeline

Thanks for your help
fields.summary: Cannot create new pipeline after deleting the first one

fields.description: It's to small to read my code on smartphone. There are many text too big, or window accessories not necessarily.
fields.summary: To Small Code to See

fields.description: The deployment UI is showing no info regarding the the deployment, it just makes tonnes of XHR requests replacing the screen with meaningless/empty info boxes.
fields.summary: Deployment UI broken

fields.description:
*How to reproduce*

* On a mercurial repo go to Branches tab.
* Click on "Create branch".
* The only "From branch" available is the branch set as default.

*Workaround*

h3. 1.
* Go to repo Settings.
* Set the default branch to the branch you intend to use.
* Create the branch from the correct one.
* Set the default branch back to the correct one.

h3. 2.
Create a new branch locally, add commits and push to remote:\\
hg push --new-branch
fields.summary: Mecurial repos are only able to create a branch from default branch.

fields.description:
The problem: some archives with diff in commit are irrelevants to analyse, for example package.lock or compose.lock

Sugestion: a button to colapse and expand the diff of each file
fields.summary: Ability to colapse diff code

fields.description:
While it is humanized, is there a way for me to see the exact timings of an activity on a PR? We are a startup and we take builds quite frequently. I want to know the exact timing upto minutes at least in order to make out if my changes were published or not after the PR got merged to main branch.

This hour and days thing is not at all helpful. It will be of big value to me as the end user if i could in some way turn on the activity times to be accurate.
fields.summary: Activity timings - not accurate

fields.description:
Sometimes a pipeline will fail to clone the repository.

"There was a network error trying to clone the repository. Please try again."

It would be nice if Pipelines retried instead of making me retry it.

* GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone --branch="master" --depth 50 https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/$BITBUCKET_REPO_FULL_NAME.git $BUILD_DIR\\
Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'...\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/atlassian/uchi-ui.git/': The requested URL returned error: 504
fields.summary: Pipelines - retry when clone fails

fields.description:
I have more than 100 repos is there a way i can create an audit report in which i get the list of repositories in which the branch permission are not set.

If Branch permission are not set it exposes repository to the branch deletion.

My Team name is : WWE Development

Please let me know if you have any issues
fields.summary: Identify Repositories in which Branch Permission is not set

fields.description:
In the 1.0 version of the comment API you are able to specify the commit sha or revision to "anchor" a comment to when posting inline comments using the "dest_rev", "base_rev", and "anchor" keys. This is still not possible in version 2.0 of the API as far as the documentation says and we have tested, which makes the API impossible to use for a robust integration. This seems like a major loss of functionality that will render our application very unreliable and in some cases unusable to customers when 1.0 API support is removed. All other code providers we have integrated with support this functionality (github, gitlab, bitbucket server, bitbucket cloud 1.0 APIs etc).

Without knowing which revision your comment will get posted to, the line number and path could be pointing to the wrong place since each revision/commit can change the underlying code. It seems like the current behavior is to just use the latest commit on a PR with this API, but given the async nature of bitbucket it is impossible for the caller to reliably and robustly know what will be the latest revision is on the pull request since it may have changed since you last checked it even if checking immediately before posting. However it also makes it so a client/consumer of the API can't post comments if there has been a change since they started referencing a line on a file.

Similarly in the listing 2.0 API for pull request comments, we can't get this revision any way except by parsing the {{href}} link which is somewhat unfortunate but it does at least work for now.
fields.summary: Missing parameter in api 2.0 - pull request comment dest_rev or base_rev

fields.description: For private repositories, if a member is removed, that user is also removed as follower. This doesn't apply for public repositories.
fields.summary: When a user is removed from a public repository, that user is still a follower

fields.description:
Hi, ssh suddenly stopped working and it returns git@bitbucket.org: Permission denied (public key). However, all other services I use with the same public key works. I have removed the key several times from settings, but I still get this error.

Yesterday, I have pushed something to the repo, today, I can't. Could you have a look?

I'happy to check at another end as well, my public key is here:

(redacted)

Connecting via VSC & Pageant, Windows 7 Pro
fields.summary: SSH stopped working

fields.description:
Hi\\
I have received the following email\\
and I don't understand why\\
Our team is made of 9 people

subject:\\
[Bitbucket] Plan changed

body:\\
Important information from Bitbucket\\
Your Bitbucket plan has changed

The plan on the Bitbucket team, [redacted], has changed from Standard to Free.\\
Thanks,\\
The Bitbucket Team
fields.summary: pricing plan downgrade

fields.description: A pipeline might contain a manual checkpoint / step in it to prevent unnecessary steps from being executed and wasting build minutes on every commit, but sometimes when triggering a build you know you want that second stage of the build process to execute before it gets to the point to trigger it manually. So, can there be an option to trigger the manual step, provided the build is successful to that point. This saves time waiting / staring at the pipeline for it to get to that point.
fields.summary: Trigger manual step ahead of time
